title: Olsen-Baker scores superb try for 'dreamy' New Zealand
summary: New Zealand's Kaipo Olsen-Baker goes over for her second try of the game to give the reigning World Champions a 30-10 lead over South Africa in their Women's Rugby World Cup quarter-final at Sandy Park.

title: The stand-in superstar - Rowland steps up to replace Kildunne
summary: Helena Rowland has largely been restricted to a World Cup bench role, but with Ellie Kildunne injured, her importance is clear as she starts at full-back for England against Scotland.

title: GB's Azu, Glave and Hughes through to 100m semi-finals
summary: Great Britain's Jeremiah Azu and Zharnel Hughes progress to the 100m semi-finals with Romell Glave joining them after holding on to a non-automatic qualifying spot with a time of 10.00 at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo.

title: Shock as GB's Muir crashes out of 1500m
summary: Great Britain's Laura Muir crashes out of the World Athletics Championships, finishing eighth in her 1500m heat.

title: South Africa inflict record defeat on New Zealand
summary: New Zealand suffer their biggest defeat in history as they lose 43-10 to South Africa in the Rugby Championship in Wellington.

title: British trio reach women's 100m semi-finals
summary: Great Britain's Daryll Neita runs a season's best to win her heat with Dina Asher-Smith and Amy Hunt also qualifying for the women's 100m semi-finals at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo.

title: 'Owners support me' - Selles bullish despite Blades' start
summary: Sheffield United head coach Ruben Selles says he has the support of the club's board despite their worst start to a season for 30 years.

title: Down but not out! Beamish falls in steeplechase but still qualifies
summary: New Zealand's Geordie Beamish falls on the last lap of his 3000m steeplechase heat but recovers to finish second and qualify for the final at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo.

title: Auld enemies to old news, but Scotland aim to reignite rivalry
summary: England have not lost to Scotland this millennium. But Donna Kennedy, among the last Scots to beat England, says the current crop will believe they can oust the World Cup hosts.

title: 'Crocker v Donovan title fight could define careers'
summary: When Lewis Crocker and Paddy Donovan step through the ropes at Belfast's Windsor Park on Saturday night, winning the vacant IBF welterweight title will be their primary goal, but the prize is so much more greater.

title: Returning in quarter-final a huge ask for Wafer

title: 'It may be a chess match' - Canelo v Crawford predictions

title: Hasegawa & Shaw seal Man City comeback against Brighton
summary: Watch as Manchester City score two second-half goal to come from behind against Brighton & Hove Albion to secure a 2-1 victory in the Women's Super League.

title: Russo double helps Arsenal cruise to victory against West Ham
summary: A brace from Alessia Russo catapults Arsenal to the top of the WSL table, as they put five goals past winless West Ham United, who now sit bottom of the league.

summary: American Ben Griffin warms up for the Ryder Cup by moving into a three-shot lead at the end of the second round of the Procore Championship.

title: Record-breaking Salt helps England to historic win against South Africa
